intro: Laplacea ovalis, commonly known as the oval laplacea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
